msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Integrated TLF build 442. This integration required some minor changes to framework code.
The advanced text format styles for Spark components now include four new inheriting styles corresponding to new TLF formats:
paragraphSpaceBefore and paragraphSpaceAfter are for adding space before and after a paragraph.

paragraphStartIndent and paragraphEndIndent are for indenting the entire paragraph (not just its first line), from either the "starting" or "ending" side, which depend on the direction of the paragraph.
All four styles are specified in pixels, and have a default value of 0 coming from the global selector.
You can set these styles on a component and they'll apply to all paragraphs. For example, simply setting <s:TextArea paragraphSpaceAfter="20"> will put 20 pixels of space after each paragraph.

TLF has removed its old non-inheriting marginXXX formats, so markup like

...

is no longer allowed in text content. These formats were in the FXG 1.0 spec, so FXG 1.0 compilation will need to change to map
* Fix 2300102 Spans with attached event listeners should not merge
-- marginTop, marginBottom, marginLeft and marginRight formats have been renamed to paragraphSpaceBefore, paragraphSpaceAfter, paragraphStartIndent and paragraphEndIndent respectively
-- paragraphStartIndent and paragraphEndIndent are direction-sensitive. For example, the former applies to the paragraph's left edge for left-to-right text, and to the right edge otherwise
-- These formats now inherit values from parent flow element if undefined during cascade
-- The previous names continue to be supported on import of FXG markup (but not TLF markup). FXG export uses the new names.
* UndoManager and IUndoManager moved from flashx.textLayout.edit into flashx.undo namespace (actually done in build 436)
QE Notes: Need tests for these new styles.

A collection of skinning and styling bug fixes.
SDK-21061 - borderColor style appears when color is set to red (or 0xFF0000) for Halo Button with Spark skin
SDK-20818 - When the SparkDownloadProgressBar shows an error, the bar should be visible.
SDK-20735 - The documentation for the protected property initProgressHandler mentions the label of a Spark DownloadProgressBar even though it has no label.
SDK-20732 - The backgroundImage property does nothing for the SparkDownloadProgressBar
SDK-20101 - Halo ColorPicker with Spark skin doesnt look very good after setting scaleX or scaleY
SDK-20150 - Emphasized FxButton needs wireframe theme skin
SDK-19584 - When an item is disabled in a Menu, the branch icon does not look disabled.
QA: The errorColor has changed slightly (0xFF0000 to 0xFE0000), so new bitmaps need to be generated
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Skinning and styling bug fixes for Beta 1.
* Changed default closeDuration to 50. The default openDuration is 0, so it needed to be balanced by a short closeDuration.
* Made DownloadProgressBar.initCompleteHandler protected. It was private.
QA/Docs: Note changes to default value of closeDuration, and making DownloadProgressBar.initCompleteHandler protected.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Add error skin for Spark components. The error skin is a separate skin, handled in a similar manner as the focus skin. It is shown whenever the errorString property is non-empty. The default implementation overlays a red border on top of the component.
Fixed the font size for tooltips/error tips.
QE: Yes - spark tests for errorString/validation failure need to be added
Doc: Yes - new errorSkin style on SkinnableComponent
